utter_greet: Hey! How can I help you?

Hello! How can I help you?
Hey there! How can I help you?
utter_unclear: I'm not sure how to help you

utter_does_help: Is it clearer for you know
utter_show_more: Well then I can present you a section where you should find information you are looking for
In that case I can navigate you to a section where you can find additional information
utter_next: Do you have any other questions?
Is there anything more you want to ask?
utter_happy_to_help: I'm glad that I could help :)
utter_get_help: I'm an intelligent chatbot with knowledge about the methodology of running and managing SCRUM projects. I can answer your questions related to SCRUM, help you add some items to a virtual dashboard or new members to the team.
utter_get_help_scrum: SCRUM is a framework within which people can address complex adaptive problems, while productively and creatively delivering products of the highest possible value.
utter_get_help_scrum_master: The Scrum Master is a servant-leader for the Scrum Team. SM is responsible for promoting and supporting Scrum as defined in the Scrum Guide
utter_get_help_product_owner: The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog. PO is responsible for maximizing the value of the product resulting from work of the Development Team
utter_get_help_dev: The Development Team consists of professionals who do the work of delivering a potentially releasable Increment of 'Done' product at the end of each Sprint.
utter_get_help_sprint: The heart of Scrum is a Sprint, a time-box of one month or less during which a 'Done' Increment is created. Sprints consist of the Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums, the development work, the Sprint Review, and the Sprint Retrospective
utter_get_help_planning: At the Sprint Planning the work to be performed in the Sprint is planned. This plan is created by the collaborative work of the entire Scrum Team.
utter_get_help_daily: The Daily Scrum is a 15-minute time-boxed event when the Development Team plans work for the next 24 hours
utter_get_help_review: A Sprint Review is held at the end of the Sprint to inspect the Increment and adapt the Product Backlog if needed.
utter_get_help_retrospective: The Sprint Retrospective is an opportunity for the Scrum Team to inspect itself and create a plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint.
utter_get_help_increment: The Increment is the sum of all the Product Backlog items completed during a Sprint and the value of the increments of all previous Sprints.
utter_get_help_story_points: A story point is a metric used in agile project management and development to estimate the difficulty of implementing a given user story
utter_create_task: Ok, I will need some information to perform that operation. Specificaly at least task type, assignee and your estimation.
utter_task_created: Great! The new item has been added to the virtual scrum dashboard.
utter_create_task_get_help: Task types which you can use are: task, user story or epic. You should estimate in story points. Don't forget to specify the unit of measure. An assignee is a developer who will be responsible for doing the task.
utter_more_info: I haven't found following entities in your message:

utter_add_member_get_help: Account types which you can choose are: Scrum Master, Product Owner and Software Developer. You can also add some skills like: frontend, backend, desktop development, mobile development and web development but these are optional.
utter_add_member: Tell me name and surname of a person who you want to create an account for and his role in the scrum team.
utter_add_member_confirm: Cool! Let's summarize. You want to add a profile of {} who is a {}. Is it correct?
utter_add_member_with_skills_confirm: Cool! Let's summarize. You want to add a profile of {} who is a {} and who can perform tasks related to: {}. Is it correct?
utter_member_added: Superb! The new member has been added to the team!
